sub_topic: Calculating the effect of changing the concentration of reactants or products on the equilibrium position of a redox reaction
message_1:
What will be the effect of increasing the concentration of the reactants on the equilibrium position of a redox reaction given the following balanced equation:

Fe(s) + CuSO4(aq) <=> FeSO4(aq) + Cu(s) 

Calculate the new value of the equilibrium constant (Kc) if the concentration of Fe(s) is increased from 0.2 M to 0.4 M while keeping the concentration of CuSO4(aq) as 0.1 M.
message_2:
Increasing the concentration of the reactants in a redox reaction will shift the equilibrium position to favor the formation of products. In this case, increasing the concentration of Fe(s) will lead to the formation of more FeSO4(aq) and Cu(s).

However, it is important to note that the equilibrium constant (Kc) does not change with changes in concentration. The equilibrium constant is only affected by changes in temperature. Therefore, the value of Kc will remain the same even if the concentration of Fe(s) is increased from 0.2 M to 0.4 M.
